subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Use of half-letters
msgSnippet: Whether via the internet or the postal service, the reading practice would be welcome.  I make a point to save and re-read my own writing after a time, but
messageBody:
Whether via the internet or the postal service, the reading practice would be welcome.  I make a point to save and re-read my own writing after a time, but growing accustomed to reading others' handwriting would be of immense benefit.  I know the variance in TO is amazing, so I can imagine we each have our idiosyncrasies with QS.

This sounds like great fun.

Ron Cameron

----- Original Message ----
From: Benct Philip Jonsson <bpj@...>
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, September 19, 2007 3:13:08 AM
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Use of half-letters

On 2007-09-19 pgabhart wrote:
> I don't know if this would work today since people are so
> computer-oriented, but reading other people's handwritten
> QS is very good practice in my opinion.

In a way it would work even better today: anyone with a
scanner (most people have direct or indirect access to them
today, I'd believe, since many printshops and the like offer
scanning at a small cost) can scan their QS and make it
available to read for anyone with an internet connexion, and
Google and others offer somewhere to upload at no cost.

: /|
: _| | /BP
: \|
